intro: Girtanneria theezans, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, cup-like structures that hold the flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Girtanneria theezans is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds.
